title.value: Development of a Framework for Establishing ‘Gold Standard’ Outbreak Data from Submitted SARS-CoV-2 Genome Samples
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Development of a Framework for Establishing ‘Gold Standard’ Outbreak Data from Submitted SARS-CoV-2 Genome Samples

extractions.description: This paper presents a framework utilizing Bayesian online change point detection (BOCP) to establish 'gold standard' outbreak onset dates from submitted genomic data of SARS-CoV-2 variants, specifically focusing on the Omicron variant, to improve outbreak detection and evaluation of surveillance systems.

type.justification: The study involves practical application of a Bayesian algorithm to real-world genomic data to identify outbreak onset dates, indicating it is empirical.
type.quote: Our study applied the Bayesian online change point detection algorithm (BOCP) to the number of Omicron genome sequences collected worldwide...

name.justification: The paper focuses on genomic data from SARS-CoV-2 for outbreak detection, situating it within genomic surveillance.
name.quote: Genomic surveillance plays an increasingly important role in tracking virus evolution and risk assessment for important pathogens.

name.justification: The study is aimed at establishing outbreak onset dates using genomic data, which is central to outbreak detection.
name.quote: Our study presents a framework for using global genomic submission data to develop ‘gold standard’ dates about the onset of outbreaks...

name.justification: The paper employs Bayesian online change point detection to analyze genomic data.
name.quote: Our study used a Bayesian online change point detection algorithm (BOCP) to detect increases in the number of submitted genome samples...

name.justification: The BOCP model is the primary method used for detecting outbreaks in the genomic data.
name.quote: Our study used a Bayesian online change point detection algorithm (BOCP) to detect increases in the number of submitted genome samples...

is_contributed.justification: The paper utilizes the BOCP model but does not contribute to its development.
is_contributed.quote: We implemented Bayesian change point detection analyses [10] using the R package ocp (version 0.1.1)...

is_executed.justification: BOCP is actively applied to the genomic data in this study.
is_executed.quote: We implemented Bayesian change point detection analyses [10] using the R package ocp (version 0.1.1) and a Gaussian underlying predictive model...

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is analyzed and compared using different data transformations and parameter values.
is_compared.quote: We compared models using different data transformations and parameter values...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for the BOCP model is cited in relation to its methodology.

name.justification: GISAID is the primary source of the genomic data used in the study.
name.quote: From the Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data (GISAID ^{2} )...

referenced_paper_title.value: Global landscape of SARS-CoV-2 genomic surveillance and data sharing
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references GISAID in the context of this study's data source.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Chen Z, Azman AS, Chen X, Zou J, Tian Y, Sun R, et al. Global landscape of SARS-CoV-2 genomic surveillance and data sharing. Nat Genet 2022;54:499–507.

name.justification: The 'ocp' package is used for implementing BOCP in the paper.
name.quote: We implemented Bayesian change point detection analyses [10] using the R package ocp (version 0.1.1)...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The ocp package is directly cited in the paper for its role in the analysis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Pagotto A. ocp: Bayesian Online Changepoint Detection 2019.
